Scene-1.name: Narrator
Scene-1.text: You wake up in a prison. You are lost within your own thoughts. Your crimes cloud you, unknown as to what you have done to deserve such punishment.

Scene-1.name: Narrator
Scene-1.text: You hear banging to the left of you it must be your cell neighbor you're in such a small cell this must be solitary.

Scene-1.name: Neighbor
Scene-1.text: "Hello, I see you are awake" His words meet your ears "today's your lucky day". you shudder thinking what that probably means.

Scene-1.name: Narrator
Scene-1.text: You realize you are fated to die today at dawn. You are unaware of why, but the world knows. The prison knows. Everybody knowsâ€¦

Scene-1.name: Narrator
Scene-1.text: You must escape, and the sound of rollcall may be your first chance of salvation.

Scene-2.name: Narrator
Scene-2.text: You go outside your room and stand in line with your cell with the rest of the prisoners in the block. You see a man in a suit flanked by 2 guards he clearly commands authority.

Scene-2.name: Warden
Scene-2.text: "Hello Inmates I hope you're enjoying death row one of you today is very lucky. You're leaving us and going to where you belong to rot."

Scene-2.name: Your Thoughts
Scene-2.text: *He laughs at the misery of others especially me you think*

Scene-2.name: Warden
Scene-2.text: "Alright now lets begin roll call Preston, Jeff, Adrian, and of course our lucky winner YOU. "

Scene-2.name: Narrator
Scene-2.text: "Here" You answer weakly unsure of why the warden has such a vendetta against you or why he seems to be enjoying it.

Scene-2.name: Narrator
Scene-2.text: You make out the 2 guards nametag as they usher you into the cafeteria Mack and Garrett you hope they are nice to you.

Scene-3.name: Narrator
Scene-3.text: You get to the chow hall and get your food. As you go sit down you realize that you don't really know anyone and there seems to be a lot of people that it would be a mistake to stick next to.

Scene-3.name: Narrator
Scene-3.text: You see someone sticking to themselves they seem relatively harmless maybe that would be a good choice you think and you remember them from roll call.

Scene-3.name: Narrator
Scene-3.text: As you start walking over there is someone else beckoning you over as you remember him from roll call too and he is still just as scary now. You are presented a choice.

Choice-3.Choice2: Talk to inmate calling you over

Scene-Preston.name: Preston
Scene-Preston.text: You decide to ignore the scary guy after all what good could come from that you hope you won't regret it.

Scene-Preston.name: Preston
Scene-Preston.text: He responds with "You don't remember me do you?"

Scene-Preston.name: Narrator
Scene-Preston.text: You're unsure of how to respond

Scene-Preston.name: Preston
Scene-Preston.text: "This is not the first time we have talked" he responds "In fact I feel like we have this conversation every day"

Scene-Preston.name: Narrator
Scene-Preston.text: You think maybe he is in jail with you because he's crazy. "I'm not sure what you mean" you respond

Scene-Preston.name: Preston
Scene-Preston.text: "C'mon ask me a question I'll know it"

Scene-Preston.I.name: Preston
Scene-Preston.I.text: "You're whos knocking on deaths door and if you ask the warden someone who is about to suffer for eternity after. But apart from that I would say you're just an unclucky guy who's gonna have to make some choices lest they want to suffer."

Scene-Preston.I.name: You
Scene-Preston.I.text: "Geez way to sour the mood I already know I'm going to die"

Scene-Preston.You.name: Preston
Scene-Preston.You.text: "I'm someone who has been here longer then you and knows a thing or two. You can believe me or you cannot but I would not recommend the latter."

Scene-Preston.You.name: You
Scene-Preston.You.text: "Alright, Ill try and keep that in mind"
